hypothesis_content.title: ETF Flow Reversal Catalyst with Price Anchoring
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences >$300M net ETF outflows over 3 days while price holds within 3% of a key psychological level (e.g., $85K, $90K), the subsequent reversal to inflows (>$150M daily) will trigger a 4-7% rally that accelerates as price breaks through the anchored level, with institutional FOMO amplifying the move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sustained outflows near key levels create selling exhaustion. Renewed inflows signal institutional re-engagement, with breakout above anchored levels triggering systematic buying and short covering.
entry_conditions: BTC price within ±3% of key psychological level for 2 days
Daily ETF inflow > $150M after outflow period

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7% gain from entry or 2% above psychological breakout level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price drops back below psychological level by >1.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: ETF inflow reversals fail to produce >3% moves when price is anchored near key levels, or breakdown occurs instead of breakout >40% of instances.
